content.answer: When you finance a vehicle, you are buying it from a dealer or individual using a loan supplied by a bank. This gives you ownership over the vehicle and allows you to have control over what you do with it. When you lease a vehicle, you are essentially obtaining temporary ownership limited by the terms of the lease. These terms will include a duration of the lease, as well as maximum mileage allowed per year. You will also be unable to customize the vehicle during the lease.
content.name: What is the difference between leasing and financing a car?
content.question: What is the difference between leasing and financing a car?
